alert.note: Alert for Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 3:43AM EST until February 18 at 9:00AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Kentucky... Cumberland River at Williamsburg affecting Whitley County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cumberland River at Williamsburg. * WHEN...From this morning to late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, Flooding threatens low lying roads and structures. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 PM EST Thursday the stage was 9.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage this afternoon to 21.8 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight to 19.0 feet early Sunday morning. It will rise to 19.3 feet early Sunday afternoon. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 21.8 feet on 03/22/1974. &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. The next statement will be issued by 3 PM EST Friday.
